page.title: 09WETHERBY PLANNING OFFICER
page.content: The Planning Officer said that he needed a Diploma in Town Planning to get his job. He had been a planner for twenty years and said he enjoyed the job because it was so varied. In 1981 322 houses were given planning consent and about 833 more are expected by 1991. At the{Hill Top Farm}development shops may be built, but evidence shows people prefer supermarkets. He said no new industries are planned because the new population will probably work out of Wetherby. The population in 1931 was 2774, 4179 in 1961, 7332 in 1971, 9725 in 1981 and by 1991 it is expected to increase to about 12000. All sorts of different people work in the Planning Office, including draughtsmen, administrators, enforcers environmental officers and, of course, planning officers (who mainly deal with development control).
